metadata.title: CVE-2020-8131 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Arbitrary filesystem write vulnerability in Yarn before 1.22.0 allowsattackers to write to any path on the filesystem and potentially lead toarbitrary code execution by forcing the user to install a maliciouspackage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

yarnpkg - 1.22.4-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-yarnpkg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.22.4-2').
